author: detroitnews.com
title: Entertainment calendar
text:
Lianne La Havas performs Saturday at Saint Andrew’s Hall in Detroit. (Photo: John-Paul Pietrus) 
big shows 
THURSDAY 
Kacey Musgraves at Royal Oak Music Theatre, country, 6:30 p.m. Thurs. $29.50 and up. 318 W. Fourth, Royal Oak. (248) 399-2980.
Ride at Saint Andrew’s Hall, rock, 7 p.m. Thurs. $35. 431 E. Congress, Detroit. (313) 961-8961.
Madonna at Joe Louis Arena, pop, 8 p.m. Thurs. $53-$358. 19 Steve Yzerman Drive, Detroit. (313) 396-7000.
Chameleons Vox with 800Beloved and Pewter Cub at Small’s Bar, post-punk, 8 p.m. Thurs. $17 day of show. 10339 Conant, Hamtramck. (313) 873-1117.
Margaret Cho at Andiamo Celebrity Showroom, comedy, 8 p.m. Thurs. $25-$75. 7096 E. 14 Mile, Warren. (586) 268-3200.
FRIDAY 
Hollywood Undead with Crown the Empire and I Prevail at Fillmore Detroit, rock, 6:30 p.m. Fri. $8.90-$35. 2115 Woodward, Detroit. (313) 961-5450.
Atreyu with Beartooth, Wovenwar and Malaki at Crofoot Ballroom, metal, 6:30 p.m. $23 in advance, $25 at the door. 1 S. Saginaw, Pontiac. (248) 858-9333.
Ghost with Purson at Majestic, metal, 7:30 p.m. Fri. $27.60 in advance, $32.60 day of. 4140 Woodward, Detroit. (313) 883-9700.

Avant, Ginuwine, Case, Dru Hill, Michel’le and Chico Debarge at Masonic Temple, R&B/pop, 8 p.m. Sat. $45.50-$85.50. 500 Temple, Detroit. (313) 638-2724.
Jay Leno at FireKeepers Casino Hotel, comedy, 9 p.m. Sat. $60 and up. 11177 E. Michigan, Battle Creek. (877) 352-8777.
SUNDAY 
Girls Night In with MyLifeAsEva, Meredith Foster, Alisha Marie, Sierra Furtado, Mia Stammer and Andie Case at Royal Oak Music Theatre, web stars, 7 p.m. Sun. $25 and up. 318 S. Fourth, Royal Oak. (248) 399-2980.
Mark Knopfler at Michigan Theatre, rock, 7:30 p.m. Sun. $45-$205.50. 603 E. Liberty, Ann Arbor. (734) 668-8397.
Stephanie Mills at Andiamo Celebrity Showroom, R&B/soul/Gospel, 8 p.m. Sun. $25-$75. 7096 E. 14 Mile, Warren. (586) 268-3200.

Kraftwerk at Masonic Temple, electronic music, 7 p.m. Mon. $39.50-$79.50. 500 Temple, Detroit. (248) 858-9333.

Kyle Lucas with Jonny Craig at Hatchy’s, rock, 7 p.m. Thurs. $13 in advance, $15 at the door. 7759 Auburn, Utica. (586) 991-0407.

Norma Jean at Shelter, metal, 6 p.m. Mon. $18. 431 E. Congress, Detroit. (313) 961-8961.
Gene Ween with Scotty Karate at Blind Pig, rock, 8 p.m. Mon. $16 in advance, $18 day of. 208 S. First, Ann Arbor. (734) 996-8555.

Hopsin, Dizzy Wright, Jarren Benton and more at Saint Andrew’s Hall, hip-hop, 7 p.m. Wed. $27.50. 431 E. Congress, Detroit. (313) 961-8961.
Taylor Davis at Magic Bag, pop/classical, 8 p.m. Wed. $15. 22920 Woodward, Ferndale. (248) 544-3030.

THURSDAY 
Ott, Plantae and Aligning Minds at Populux, 9:30 p.m. Thurs. $15 in advance, $20 day of. 4120 Woodward, Detroit. (313) 833-9700.
FRIDAY 
Borgeous at Elektricity, 9:30 p.m. Fri. $17. 15 S. Saginaw, Pontiac. (248) 599-2212.

stage/comedy 
THIS WEEK 
Theatre Nova presents “Bright Half Life” at Yellow Barn, 7:30 p.m. Thurs.-Sat. and 2 p.m. Sun. (through Oct. 25). $20 suggested donation. 416 W. Huron, Ann Arbor. (734) 635-8450.
“Evil Dead: the Musical” at City Theatre, 8 p.m. Thurs.-Sat. (through Oct. 31). $30. 2301 Woodward, Detroit. (313) 471-3465.
Comedians DC Benny with Michael Geeter and Leslie Ann Thompson at Mark Ridley’s Comedy Castle, 8 p.m. Thurs.-Fri. and 8 and 10:30 p.m. Sat. $10-$18. 310 S. Troy, Royal Oak. (248) 542-9900.
The Fryman at Joey’s Comedy Club, 8 p.m. Thurs. and 8 and 10:15 p.m. Fri.-Sat. $12-$16, $25-$29 dinner and show. 36071 Plymouth, Livonia. (734) 261-0555.
Open Book Theatre Company presents “The Shadow Box” at Penelope’s Venue, 8 p.m. Thurs.-Sat. $20, $15 seniors and students. 12219 Dix Toledo, Southgate. (734) 288-7753.
“Who’s Afraid of Virginia Woolf?” at Performance Network Theatre, 8 p.m. Thurs.-Sat. and 2 p.m. Sun. (through Nov. 1). $25 and up. 120 E. Huron, Ann Arbor. (734) 663-0681.
Comedian D.C. Malone at Ann Arbor Comedy Showcase, 8 p.m. Thurs. and 8 and 10:30 p.m. Fri.-Sat. $9-$12 in advance, $11-$14 at the door. 212 S. Fourth, Ann Arbor. (734) 996-9080.
“A Kid Like Jake” at Matrix Theatre, 8 p.m. Fri.-Sat. and 3 p.m. Sun. (through Oct. 11). $15-$20. 2730 Bagley, Detroit. (313) 967-0599.
“Seance 13” at Planet Ant Theatre, 8 p.m. Fri.-Sat. (through Oct. 17). $10-$20. 2357 Caniff, Hamtramck. planetant.com .
“The Whale” by Samuel D. Hunter at the Ringwald Theatre, 8 p.m. Fri.-Sat. and Mon. and 3 p.m. Sun. (through Oct. 26). $25. 22742 Woodward, Ferndale. (313) 993-3270.
“Young Frankenstein” at Stagecrafters at Baldwin Theatre, 8 p.m. Fri.-Sat. and 2 p.m. Sun. $22-$24. 415 S. Lafayette, Royal Oak. (248) 541-6430. .
“Boeing Boeing” at Farmington Players Barn, 8 p.m. Fri.-Sat. and 2 p.m. Sun. (through Oct. 10). $16, $14 seniors and students. 32332 W. 12 Mile, Farmington Hills. (248) 553-2955.
SATURDAY 
Not Just for Kids series presents “Dog Loves Books” at Michigan Theater, 1:30 p.m. Sat. $12. 603 E. Liberty, Ann Arbor. (734) 668-8397.
Michigan Opera Theatre Opera Ball Gala featuring American Ballet Theatre dancers Misty Copeland and Gabe Stone Shayer at Detroit Opera House, 6 p.m. Sat. $750. Young patron party is 8 p.m. Sat. $100. 1526 Broadway, Detroit. (313) 237-3268.
MONDAY 
“Stuff You Should Know” podcast at Saint Andrew’s Hall, 8 p.m. Mon. $20. 431 E. Congress, Detroit. (313) 961-8961.
visual arts/film 
OPENING THURSDAY 
Canton Fire Arts Exhibition at Village Theater at Cherry Hill, 6:30 p.m. Thurs. artist reception, runs 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Mon.-Fri. through Oct. 31. 50400 Cherry Hill, Canton. (734) 394-5300.
etc. 
THURSDAY 
Karmanos Cancer Institute’s 22nd annual Partners Night at Russell Industrial Center, 7 p.m. Thurs. $175-$250. 1600 Clay, Detroit. (313) 576-8108.
THIS WEEKEND 
Paws in the Park with pet adoptions, food, shopping and more at Memorial Park, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Sat.-Sun. 13 Mile and Woodward, Royal Oak. www.pawsintheparkroyaloak.com 
FRIDAY 
Fit for the Cure Wacoal bra-fitting event at Von Maur in Laurel Park Place, 10 a.m.-8 p.m. Fri. 37500 Six Mile, Livonia. (734) 432-6949.
October in the ’Ville with life-sized skeletons display (up through Halloween), entertainment, food and more in downtown Northville, 6-9 p.m. Fri. Town Square on Main, Northville. www.downtownnorthville.com .
Mom and Son Pirate Dance Party at Costick Center, 7-8:30 p.m. Fri. $14, $9 residents. 28600 11 Mile, Farmington Hills. (248) 473-1800.
SATURDAY 
Turning Point presents Tara’s Walk in memory of Tara Grant at Freedom Hill Amphitheater, 9 a.m. Sat. $20. 14900 Metropolitan Parkway, Sterling Heights. (586) 463-4430.
Bras for Cause benefit for Gilda’s Club Metro Detroit at Royal Oak Music Theatre, 6 p.m. Sat. $50 and up. 318 W. Fourth, Royal Oak. (248) 399-2980.
Moon Dusters ballroom dancing with a live band at Livonia Civic Center, 8-11 p.m. Sat. $8. 15218 Farmington, Livonia. (248) 968-5197.

OUR PICKS 
BIG ’80S FLASHBACK BASH 
at PJ’s Lager House 
For 20 years, the Big ’80s Flashback Bash has been celebrating punk, new wave and rock music each year around Halloween. This year’s lineup includes live band tributes to the Clash, the Ramones, the Replacements and more. Partial proceeds benefit Hater Kitty cat rescue group. 9 p.m. Fri. $6. 1254 Michigan, Detroit. (313) 961-4668.
YOURS TRULY, JOHN WATERS 
at State Theatre 
Every Wednesday, the State Theatre in Ann Arbor will host “Yours Truly, John Waters,” a 10-film retrospective of the director’s work. It kicks off Wednesday with the 1972 film “Pink Flamingos” staring Divine. For Johnny Depp fans, note that “Crybaby” will be screened on Nov. 18. “Cecil B. Demented” will close out the series on Dec. 9. 7 p.m. Wed. $10, $8 seniors, students, children and veterans. 233 S. State, Ann Arbor. (734) 761-8667.
